actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I. The next meeting is scheduled for 6:30 p.m. on January 6, 2026.

Pursuant to section 8 of H. Res. 936, the Chair announced that no organizational or legislative business will be conducted on this day. Messages requiring action will be laid before the House on a subsequent day. Bills and resolutions introduced today will receive a number but will not be referred to committee or noted in the Record until a subsequent day. Executive communications, memorials, and petitions likewise will be referred and numbered on a subsequent day.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Christopher H. Smith to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened pursuant to the 20th Amendment to the Constitution and was called to order by the Chair.
Pursuant to the 20th Amendment of the Constitution, the Chair declares the 1st Session of the One Hundred Nineteenth Congress adjourned sine die.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 3.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House received a communication from Representative Greene (GA) wherein she resigns as a member of the House of Representatives effective at 11:59 p.m. on January 5, 2026.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Christopher H. Smith to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
